stepAnswer: Escalating the resolution of the data quality issue that the data scientist found. Once the time the issue has existed exceeds the remediation SLA defined in the data quality policy, it is time to escalate.
stepTitle: As a data analyst who writes reports and analyzes data, you have identified a data quality issue in the underlying data on one of your reports. You know that you need to fix the issue and that the data governance team can help facilitate. What is the data governance team responsible for in this case?
choices: Defining data quality rules for the data that the analyst uses

Escalating the resolution of the data quality issue that the data scientist found. Once the time the issue has existed exceeds the remediation SLA defined in the data quality policy, it is time to escalate.

Escalating the resolution of the data quality issue that the data scientist found. Once the time the issue has existed exceeds the remediation SLA defined in the data quality policy, it is time to escalate.
Remediating all the data quality issues which the data analyst has identified
